title: Project U.F.O.
resume: Project U.F.O. is a NBC television series which lasted two seasons, from 1978 to 1979. Based loosely on the real-life Project Blue Book, the show was created by Dragnet veteran Jack Webb, who pored through Air Force files looking for episode ideas. This was the final show produced by Webb's Mark VII Limited, but in the case of this show it was produced in association with Worldvision Enterprises; this was the only Mark VII production not produced with the two other studios closely associated with Mark VII -- Warner Bros. or MCA TV / Universal Television.

Based loosely on the real-life Project Blue Book, the show was created by Dragnet veteran Jack Webb, who pored through Air Force files looking for episode ideas. This was the final show produced by Webb's Mark VII Limited, but in the case of this show it was produced in association with Worldvision Enterprises; this was the only Mark VII production not produced with the two other studios closely associated with Mark VII -- Warner Bros. or MCA TV / Universal Television.
